UI.I2C_DETECT_DOC: Automatically scan and set the I2C address for your MCP23017 chip. Click to detect and update the config.
UI.I2C_ADDRESS_DOC: Set the I2C address for your MCP23017 (e.g. 0x20). This is needed for buttons/LEDs control.
UI.IR_REMOTE_ENABLE_DOC: Enable or disable IR remote support. Choose your remote and GPIO pin.
UI.IR_REMOTE_TYPE_DOC: Select your remote control type for correct configuration.
UI.IR_GPIO_PIN_DOC: Choose which Raspberry Pi GPIO pin your IR receiver is connected to.
UI.ROTARY_ENABLE_DOC: Enable or disable rotary encoder support (for volume or menu navigation).
UI.DISPLAY_TEST_DOC: Click to show a test pattern or info on the display.
UI.DISPLAY_REFRESH_RATE_DOC: Set how often the display refreshes per second.
UI.SAVE_SETTINGS_DOC: Save all changes to Quadify configuration.
UI.RESTART_QUADIFY_DOC: Apply changes by restarting the Quadify service.
UI.LOG_LEVEL_DOC: Set how much information Quadify writes to its log file.
UI.OPEN_PLUGDOC_DOC: Read the official Quadify guide and troubleshooting help.
UI.BUTTONSLEDS_ENABLE_DOC: Enable physical button and LED control (requires MCP23017).

ERRORS.SYSTEMD_FAIL: Failed to start the Quadify service.
ERRORS.REMOTE_FAIL: IR remote configuration failed. Check connections and settings.
ERRORS.I2C_DETECT_FAIL: Could not detect MCP23017. Is it connected?
ERRORS.CONFIG_FILE_ERROR: Could not update the config.yaml file.

DOCUMENTATION.title: Configuring Quadify for Volumio
DOCUMENTATION.intro: Welcome to the Quadify plugin! This tool adds powerful display, button/LED, rotary, and remote support to Volumio 3. All hardware features can be enabled or configured here. Changes will be saved to your Quadify config and applied on restart.
DOCUMENTATION.setup: To get started, connect your hardware (OLED display, buttons, rotary encoder, IR receiver) and use the controls above to configure pins, addresses, and features. Click 'Detect MCP23017' to auto-scan I2C address if using buttons/LEDs.
DOCUMENTATION.troubleshooting: If you encounter problems, check wiring first, then ensure all dependencies were installed. View logs for details.
DOCUMENTATION.help: For detailed help or to report bugs, visit the Quadify GitHub repository.
